title: Greater dog-like bat
text:
The greater dog-like bat ("Peropteryx kappleri") is a <a href="bat">bat</a> <a href="species">species</a> from <a href="Central%20America">Central America</a> and <a href="South%20America">South America</a>. It is found from southern <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a> through <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a> and <a href="Peru">Peru</a>.
Description.
It is the largest member of its genus, with a forearm length of .
Individuals weigh approximately .
Fur color can vary, with some individuals dark brown and others light brown.
The ventral fur is paler than the dorsal fur.
It has large black ears.
Its <a href="dentition%23Dental%20formula">dental formula</a> is for a total of 32 teeth.
